bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 2 (1) and (1.1), slaughter establishments are designated as being subject to Part 2 of the Act.
The following classes of licences are established:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Class A licences, issued in relation to slaughter at a slaughter establishment that has both

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a slaughter area, and
food premises referred to in paragraph (a) [meat product processing] of the definition of "slaughter establishment"

for which no Class D or E licence has been issued;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: apply to the minister on a form specified by the minister, and
provide the minister with any information the minister reasonably requires in order to evaluate the application.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Compliance requirements for Class D and E licence holders

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a Class D licence for a rural slaughter establishment must ensure compliance with the following restrictions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in any compliance year, no more than 25 animal units are slaughtered at the slaughter establishment;
meat products from the slaughter establishment are sold only in the area authorized by the licence and only to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: food premises located in that area,
consumers directly at a temporary food market in that area, or
consumers directly from food premises that are located on the same property as the slaughter establishment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a Class E licence for a rural slaughter establishment must ensure compliance with the following restrictions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in any compliance year, no more than 10 animal units are slaughtered at the slaughter establishment;
meat products from the slaughter establishment are sold only in the area authorized by the licence and only to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: consumers directly at a temporary food market in that area, or
consumers directly from food premises that are located on the same property as the slaughter establishment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section, the compliance year for a licence is the period that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: begins,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of a new licence, on the date that the licence is issued, and
in any other case, on the anniversary of the licence issue date, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ends immediately before the next anniversary of the licence issue date.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A licence holder must post the licence in a conspicuous location in the slaughter establishment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Obligations respecting the operation of establishments

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not operate a slaughter establishment unless the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ensures that the construction of the slaughter establishment is and remains sound,

operates the slaughter establishment in a manner that ensures that the animals and carcasses are handled in a sanitary manner and without risk of contamination or spoilage of any carcass produced or stored by the slaughter establishment,
ensures that materials from which the slaughter establishment is constructed

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are and remain suitable for their intended purpose, and
are durable, easily cleaned and free from any noxious or toxic substances,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ensures that the slaughter establishment is separate from and without direct access to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: living quarters, or
any area in which activities are carried out that are incompatible with the sanitary handling of animals or carcasses,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: supplies water to the slaughter establishment from a source that is both potable and not capable of contaminating a carcass,
ensures that the slaughter establishment is connected at all times to a waste disposal system,
supplies an adequate quantity of hot and cold water under the pressure necessary to meet the water needs of the establishment,
provides artificial lighting that is adequate in intensity so as to enable the sanitary operation and maintenance of the establishment,
provides staff dressing rooms that allow staff to change their clothing in a private and clean environment,
maintains and uses ventilation equipment so as to prevent any accumulation of smoke, grease, water vapour and objectionable odours, and

maintains and uses the equipment necessary so as to ensure that the slaughter of animals and the storage and processing of carcasses is done in a manner that is sanitary and poses no risk of contamination or spoilage of any carcasses produced or stored by the slaughter establishment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not operate a slaughter establishment unless the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ensures that at all times there is a segregation of activities so that contamination of the animals or carcasses is prevented, including the segregation of all of the following from each other:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: livestock areas of the slaughter establishment;
slaughter areas of the slaughter establishment;
storage areas of the slaughter establishment;
food premises in the same building as the slaughter establishment, if applicable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: maintains and ensures that separate rooms, spaces and equipment are used solely for the segregation and disposal of held, inedible or condemned animals and carcasses, and
maintains and uses a sufficient number of sanitizing stations to ensure the effective sanitizing of knives.
